availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Livingston Circuit Court
February Term 1861.
Commonwealth of Ky Plff
Against } Breach Peace
Allison Price Deft.

This day came again the parties by Attorney And the Jury sworn herein on yesterday Appeared and took their seats. And having heard the evidence and arguments returned the following verdict Viz: "We of the Jury, find the Defendant guilty as charged in the within indictment and assess his fine at Fifty Dollars. R H Martin Foreman
Whereupon it is adjudged that plaintiff recover of the Defendant the sum of Fifty Dollars and her costs herein expended.

A Copy Att
John=W=Webb D=C.
For James=W=Cade C L C C

Comwlth
vs } Copy of Judgment
A. Price
